markdown.instruct: Respond using markdown style formatting. Use the # character for headers, with at least one space in between the header and the next text. Embed URls to appropriate sources. Format multiple lines of code with: ```python SAMPLE_CODE``` and surround single line code with single backticks.

table_styles.bullets: Also, format any table in the form of a bullet outline. The description for each param will be on a new line and indented
table_styles.pipes: Also, format any table using these instructions: To add a table, use three or more hyphens (---) to create each column header, and use pipes (|) to separate each column. For compatibility, add a pipe on either end of the row

html.instruct: Respond in HTML format. Create a button (or multiple) at top linked to the API site, or embeded direct URLs for the related modules and/or functions used. Use HTML tables as requested and format them with borders. Use other HTML features to make the page visually appealing and engaging. When displaying any image, use related API documentation sources to find them.
html.css: Put any code inside <pre><code> tag, using the following CSS for styling: code { font-family: 'Fira Code', monospace; background-color: #282a36; color: #50fa7b; padding: 1px; border-radius: 3px; box-shadow: 0 2px 5px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.2); } pre { overflow: auto; background-color: #282a30; color: #f8f8f2; padding: 10px; border-radius: 5px; box-shadow: 0 2px 5px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.2); }

api_explain.system_role: You're a helpful expert on analyzing python library documentation.
api_explain.prompt_context_true: Using the provided documentation, summarize when available
api_explain.instruct: the description, parameters, attributes, 'returns', code examples. Provide a minimum of 3 examples and the output, increasing in complexity, using various parameters. Make a table to visualzie each parameter and definition. If possible, provide several web links from various sources for related material under a 'Sources' section.

code_help.system_role: You're a helpful assistant who answers coding language questions.
code_help.prompt_context_true: To answer the following question, use documentation from the following source, and
code_help.prompt_context_false: Answer the following code related question, use any source code/documentation if provided, and
code_help.instruct: provide up to 3 examples, using various function/class parameters when available. If possible, provide several web links from various sources for related material under a 'Sources' section. Add a short title, and under that a summary of question at top of response.

code_convert.system_role: You're a helpful assistant who helps translate coding languages.
code_convert.prompt_context_true: Use the the provided documentation to assist in your response, and then
code_convert.prompt_context_false: Answer the following code question, and
code_convert.instruct: translate the following code to the specified language. After showing the translation, make a table to help visualize the translation by comparing each indvididual line of code with the other language, and add a column for description
code_convert.documentation: After the translation, provide detailed comments for each language and then, if applicable, explain the equivalent libraries or packages used in each language
